titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:17-0400

did.abstract: This correspondence consists mainly of letters to Owen concerning New Harmony, Texas and the Texas annexation question, the Oregon boundary dispute, and spiritualism. Also includes papers concerning Robert Dale Owen.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Received from the Library of the Co-Operative Union Ltd. and accessioned, 1967 (1967 1707mf).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Those wishing to reproduce, quote from, or publish material from this film should write to the Librarian, The Co-Operative Union Ltd., Holyoake House, Hanover Street, Manchester, England.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: A collection description and index to the correspondence precedes the manuscripts on this reel.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Robert Owen was a socialist and philanthropist.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in Library of the Co-Operative Union Ltd., Manchester, England.

controlaccess.subject: Boundary disputes -- Oregon.
Spiritualism.
controlaccess.geogname: Texas -- Annexation to the United States.
